title: KN Algo at the Lower Silesian Science Festival
description:
ğŸ“ KN Algo at the Lower Silesian Science Festival
On September 18, we had the pleasure of participating in the Lower Silesian Science Festival, where we presented our latest project â€“ 'Checkmate 2.0' â™Ÿï¸
It is a unique combination of the classic game of chess with modern technology. Our physical chessboard was equipped with a CoreXY mechanism and a system of electromagnets, thanks to which the pieces can move automatically. What's more â€“ the game can be played in two ways:
â™Ÿï¸ through a web application
â™Ÿï¸ or traditionally â€“ by moving pieces by hand, which are immediately detected thanks to magnetic sensors.
Checkmate 2.0 is not an ordinary board, but a truly interactive system that combines elements of computer science, automation, mechatronics, and algorithmics ğŸ¤–
During the workshops, everyone could compete with our proprietary chess engine. There were emotions, joy, and lots of fun â€“ both children and adults eagerly took up the challenge ğŸ’ª
The best players were rewarded with gadgets from our society, and we had great satisfaction seeing how much joy our project brought.
ğŸ™ We sincerely thank everyone who joined us. We are pleased that we could share the result of our work with you â€“ these are the moments that motivate us to continue working.
âš¡ And this is just the beginning! Already in October, you will be able to see an improved version of Checkmate 2.0 at the events:
ğŸ“ DaWIT â€“ October 21 (building C1, WrocÅ‚aw University of Science and Technology)
ğŸ“ DAS â€“ October 29 (building C3, WrocÅ‚aw University of Science and Technology)
See you at the chessboard! â™Ÿï¸âœ¨

title: Visit to Mitsubishi Electric
description:
On June 4, we had the opportunity to visit the headquarters of Mitsubishi Electric, where we learned about selected solutions used in industry. ğŸ­
We were able to test an image recognition application ğŸ“· and learn about tools supporting network management ğŸŒ.
We also saw industrial computers ğŸ’» and other examples of equipment used in automation.
We are pleased that we could broaden our knowledge ğŸ“š and see up close what technologies used in practice look like!

title: KN ALGO at WITKoN 2025
description:
On April 15, 2025, our Algo Research Society had the honor of participating in the second edition of WITKoN â€“ the Conference of Research Societies and Active Students, organized by the Faculty of Computer Science and Telecommunications Student Government and the Solvro and TK Games research societies. The event took place at the Faculty of Computer Science and Telecommunications of WrocÅ‚aw University of Science and Technology.

During the conference, we presented a lecture entitled 'How to play Minecraft with fast Fourier transform', which was delivered by Adrian Goral, the current vice-president of our society. During the presentation, we discussed how advanced mathematical algorithms, such as the fast Fourier transform (FFT), can be used in the game Minecraft, combining theory with practice in a virtual environment.

Participation in WITKoN was an excellent opportunity for us to present our activities, establish contacts with other research societies, and exchange experiences. We would like to thank the organizers for creating a space for integration and cooperation between students.

title: ALGO at the Open Days of WrocÅ‚aw University of Science and Technology!
description:
On April 11, 2025, our research society participated in the Open Days of WrocÅ‚aw University of Science and Technology. Our booth attracted great interest from both this year's high school graduates and current students. This year we presented the projects: SoundControl and the SteamPhony environment

During the event, we had the opportunity to have many interesting conversations. We talked about the activities of our society, the projects we are involved in, and the development opportunities offered by studying at WrocÅ‚aw University of Science and Technology.

We are pleased that we could share our passion. We hope that our conversations helped high school graduates make important decisions about their educational future.

We sincerely thank everyone for visiting our booth and showing interest. We wish you success in the upcoming high school graduation exams and hope to meet you as students of WrocÅ‚aw University of Science and Technology.

title: Lecture on Fourier Transform
description:
As part of our SoundControl project, Dr. Jacek JagodziÅ„ski prepared a special lecture on the Fourier Transform â€“ a tool without which there would be no sound analysis, data compression, or signal processing!
If you want to learn:
â€“ how to decompose a signal into frequencies,
â€“ why sines and cosines rule the world of signals,
â€“ and how we use all this in the SoundControl project
be sure to check out this lecture!

You can find the link to the material HERE

title: KN Algo visit to Beckhoff
description:
Our research society had the opportunity to participate in a presentation organized by Beckhoff. We had the chance to see the XPlanar system in action, observing the operation of levitating modules.
XPlanar is an innovative, contactless transport system that uses magnetic levitation to move products. It allows smooth and free movement, including rotation, while maintaining great flexibility in configuration and control.
Moreover, in the section dedicated to the practical aspect of the technology, we learned the basics of writing code to control this innovative system.

The visit to Beckhoff was a developing experience that will remain in our memory for a long time.

We sincerely thank Beckhoff for the interesting presentation and the opportunity to learn about the technology!

title: KN Algo visit to Mitsubishi Electric!
description:
On May 22, 2024, thanks to the courtesy of Mitsubishi Electronics, members of our society participated in a presentation of the company's latest solutions.
During the presentation, we learned about the programs:
Iconics - Advanced SCADA and visualization environment for industrial processes.
Mailab - Innovative machine learning solutions for industrial applications.
Vixio - Image recognition software that opens new possibilities in automation.

It was an extremely interesting and developing experience that gave us a picture of what the industry of the future may look like.

We sincerely thank Mitsubishi Electronics for their hospitality and fascinating presentation!
